MAN.TITLE: pcg

CALLING_SEQUENCE.CALLING_SEQUENCE_ITEM: [x, flag, err, iter, res] = pcg(A, b [, tol [, maxit [, M [, M2 [, x]]]]])
[x, flag, err, iter, res] = pcg(A, b, key=value,...)

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : symmetric positive definite full or sparse matrix of size nxn or a function returning A*x for each given x
: preconditioner: full or sparse matrix or function returning M\x (default: none)
: preconditioner: full or sparse matrix or function returning M2\x for each x (default: none)
: 0 if pcg converged to the desired tolerance within maxi iterations, 1 else
: final relative norm of the residual

DESCRIPTION.SP: Solves the linear system Ax=b using the conjugate gradient method with or without preconditioning. The preconditionning should be defined by a symmetric positive definite matrix M, or two matrices M1 and M2 such that M=M1*M2. in the case the function solves inv(M)*A*x = inv(M)*b for x. M, M1 and M2 can be Scilab functions with calling sequence y=Milx(x) which computes the corresponding left division y=Mi\x.
The A matrix must be a symmetric positive definite matrix (full or sparse) or a function with calling sequence y=Ax(x) which computes y=A*x
